intro: Ruellia humilis f. grisea, commonly known as the gray ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, grayish or whitish pubescence. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pale blue to violet in color and bloom in clusters. Ruellia humilis f. grisea is adapted to moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade.
